alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Franklin (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued January 14 at 12:23PM EST until January 14 at 1:15PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Burlington has issued a * Snow Squall Warning for... Northern Clinton County in northern New York... Eastern Franklin County in northern New York... Northwestern Grand Isle County in northwestern Vermont... * Until 115 PM EST. * At 1223 PM EST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line extending from near Cannon Corners to Harrigan, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Intense bursts of heavy snow. Gusty winds leading to blowing snow and rapidly falling visibility. Wind gusts up to 35 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Travel will become difficult and potentially dangerous within minutes. This includes Interstate 87 between mile markers 160 and 175. Locations impacted include... Chazy, Mooers, Altona, Alburgh Village, Ellenburg Depot, Champlain, Rouses Point, Alburgh, Isle La Motte, Ellenburg, West Chazy, Irona, Sciota, Alburg Tongue, Mooers Forks, King Bay, Blanchard Bay, Mud Point, Earlys Point, and Cannon Corners. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Reduce speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions. SNOW SQUALL...RADAR INDICATED
